item.title: Does the bitcoin testnet3 network support Segwit and OP_CSV?
item.description:
Does the bitcoin testnet3 network support Segwit and OP_CSV?

As far as I know, Segregated Witness and OP_CHECKSEQUENCEVERIFY are the last features needed to be able to fully implement a trustless bi-directional payment channel, from start to finish. (Technic...

item.title: Petition Pushes CFTC to Clarify Rules on Blockchain 'Delivery' - CoinDesk
item.description:
Petition Pushes CFTC to Clarify Rules on Blockchain 'Delivery' - CoinDesk

US law firm Steptoe & Johnson LLP has filed a petition with the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC), calling on the agency to provide more clarity regarding the definition of "delivery" in blockchain-based transactions. Signed by Steptoe partner Micah Green and senior policy advisor (and former CFTC commissioner) Michael Dunn, the petition centers around actions the agency took against Hong Kong-based bitcoin exchange Bitfinex in June.

item.title: IBM Launches Blockchain Cloud Services on High Security Server, LinuxONE
item.description:
IBM Launches Blockchain Cloud Services on High Security Server, LinuxONE

IBM has announced a cloud service for organizations requiring a secure environment for blockchain networks. According to the company, the service, which allows clients to test and run blockchain projects that handle private data securely, is ideal for organizations in regulated industries that need strong compliance measures.

item.title: Now it's Bitcoin's turn. Eth's hard fork was a success. It didn't even take hours to sort out (let alone days). It took about 1 minute. This goes to show that hard forks can be much safer than some FUD pushers will have you think. * /r/btc
item.description:
Now it's Bitcoin's turn. Eth's hard fork was a success. It didn't even take hours to sort out (let alone days). It took about 1 minute. This goes to show that hard forks can be much safer than some FUD pushers will have you think. * /r/btc

Now let's do 2mb (or 8mb) for Bitcoin! It's a million times easier than anyone from the "other side" will have you believe.

item.title: Nearly Half of All DAO Funds Withdrawn After Ethereum Hard Fork - CoinDesk
item.description:
Nearly Half of All DAO Funds Withdrawn After Ethereum Hard Fork - CoinDesk

Forty-three percent, or nearly half of all funds, associated with The DAO have now been withdrawn by former project investors. The activity comes hours after developers on the ethereum network executed a hard fork of its blockchain, a network change meant to specifically reverse the failure of The DAO project and move funds tied to its compromised smart contracts into a new account.

item.title: DAO Critic Defends Ethereum Hard Fork as 'Rite of Passage' - CoinDesk
item.description:
DAO Critic Defends Ethereum Hard Fork as 'Rite of Passage' - CoinDesk

A Cornell University professor of computer science who has proved to have a knack for pointing out flaws in blockchain code believes the hard fork that occurred earlier today is a sign of maturity for the ethereum platform.

item.title: Dash Presenting Solution to Decentralized Banking
item.description:
Dash Presenting Solution to Decentralized Banking

For cryptocurrency Dash, presenting at d10e next week, the goal is to have people walk away realizing that there is a lot more that can be done with cryptocurrency or digital currency than bitcoin has been able to achieve thus far, says Ryan Taylor, head of finance at Dash.

item.title: Bitcoin Weekly 2016 July 20: Bitcoin Halvening changes little, Ethereum successful hardfork, Bitcoiner travels around the world, Pokemon on the blockchain and Charlie Shrem released
item.description:
Bitcoin Weekly 2016 July 20: Bitcoin Halvening changes little, Ethereum successful hardfork, Bitcoiner travels around the world, Pokemon on the blockchain and Charlie Shrem released

The Bitcoin "halvening" happened last week-an event within the Bitcoin protocol where a new Bitcoin mining era started with the mining reward dropping to 12.5 BTC from 25 BTC. Speculation before the event held that something might happen to the market, economy or community; but so far, very little has changed in reaction.

item.title: Lightning network and lightweight clients
item.description:
Lightning network and lightweight clients

How will the lightning network handle lightweight clients? Most steps during the payment process in an LN channel don't actually require full knowledge of the blockchain or even the unconfirmed (mempool) transactions.
